results.title: Andersonville
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, David W. Rintels and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: Andersonville was the notorious Confederate prison where Union soldiers were kept as prisoners of war. It is a place where men who once fought alongside each other now kill for the shirts off their backs. Sergeant McSpadden (Frederic Forrest) and Josiah Day (Jarrod Emick) lead a fearless band of men against the brutality of the most notorious prison of its time and the savagery of its inmates. Hunted like animals and tortured without mercy, they must trust in each other and be willing to sacrifice their own lives for the chance to escape. Frankenheimer creates a powerful portrayal of the struggle for freedom where the only law is the law of survival.

results.title: Kissin' cousins
results.creator_credit: Gene Nelson, Sam Katzman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays a dual role in this film - Airforce Lieutenant Josh Morgan, and a countrified Jody Tatum. Morgan is sent by the Government on the unenviable job of trying to secure hillbilly land for a proposed missile base. Much to Morgan’s surprise he is faced with a blonde, country version of himself which means double the songs and women. Cast also includes Arthur O’Connell, Glenda Farrell, Jack Albertson and Pam Austin. Includes the following songs; “Kissin cousins”, “Barefoot ballad” and “Tender feeling”.

results.title: It happened at the world's fair
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Ted Richmond, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Friends and pilots Mike Edwards (Elvis Presley) and Danny Burke (Gary Lockwood) find themselves hitchhiking a ride with a Chinese farmer and his niece who are on their way to the World Fair in Seattle. They leave in their wake creditors, the welfare board, smugglers and a gangster, while still finding time to woo women, gamble and croon along the way. Although this is not one of Elvis’ best features, it still includes a few memorable songs such as “One broken heart for sale”, “How would you like to be” and “Take me to the fair”. Cast also includes Joan O’Brien.

results.title: Black belt Jones
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Pop Boyd (Scatman Crothers) owns a thriving karate school near downtown Los Angeles. Unfortunately it sits on a piece of land upon which the local mob wants to build its own ‘civic centre’. When the gangsters’ muscling of Pop leads to tragedy, Black Belt Jones (Jim Kelly) steps forward to exact his own brand of lightning-charged revenge. Filmmaker Robert Crouse, who showcased Bruce Lee in ‘Enter the dragon’ and Jackie Chan in ‘The big brawl’, serves up masterful action sequences in which every move is choreographed like a ballet. Cast also includes Gloria Hendry, Eric Laneuville, Alan Weeks, Andre Philippe and Vincent Barbi. See also ‘Game of death’ (1978), ‘Enter the dragon’ (1973), ‘The big brawl’ (1980).

results.title: Black eye
results.creator_credit: Jack Arnold, Pat Rooney and Pat Rooney Production
results.brief_description: Since being forced to give up his police badge following a suspension from duties, Shep Stone (Fred Williamson) has tried his hand at P.I work. Arriving home to his apartment one evening Stone finds a murder victim, and a killer waiting. Cast includes Fred Williamson, Rosemary Forsyth, Teresa Graves and Floy Dean. Based on the novel “Murder on the wild side” by Jeff Jacks.

results.title: Black Samson
results.creator_credit: Charles Bail, Daniel B. Cady, Omni Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the more conscientious and political ‘right on’ of the Blaxploitation genre, Charles Bail’s (‘Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of gold’) ‘Black Samson’ stars Rockne Tarkington as Samson, a community minded nightclub owner whose softly spoken voice and peaceful demure doesn’t deter him from sticking it to the ‘man’ when drugs invade his inner city neighbourhood. His saintly like persona is further enhanced by the staff he carries with him everywhere, which also happens to be a deadly weapon when needed. Samson’s patience is tested when the mafia begin to recruit some of the black gangs in his hood to help them distribute drugs in the area. Things get personal however when the mob rough-up his girlfriend in order to dissuade him from interfering with their racket. Naturally all hell breaks loose as Samson bands with his neighbourhood to combat the drug menace and settle his personal score. Cast also includes William Smith, Connie Strickland, Michael Payne and Carol Speed.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones and the casino of gold
results.creator_credit: Chuck Bail, William Tennant and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Tamara Dobson reprises her role as special agent Cleopatra Jones, a martial arts crime buster, who’s fierce Kung Fu moves are only eclipsed by her outlandish dress sense and heavy eye make up (Dobson is credited as her own make up artist). In her latest adventure Cleopatra finds herself in Hong Kong, taking on the vast drug cartel which is run by the evil and aptly named Dragon Lady (Stella Stevens). Highlights from this blaxploitation action film include Cleopatra’s poor attempts at undercover work, a difficult task for a 6‘2 black woman in Hong Kong, made even more impossible by her outrageous choice of wardrobe and unbelievable head gear. Cast also includes Tanny, Norman Fell, Albert Popwell and Caro Kenyatta.

results.title: Hot potato
results.creator_credit: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hot Potato is the follow up to “Black Belt Jones!” and sees Jim Kelly reprising his title role. Filmed in Thailand, the film follows the adventures of agent Jones (Kelly) who is sent to Thailand to rescue the daughter of a US Senator kidnapped by a power hungry Thai warlord. Jones teams up with local agent Pam (Irene Tsu), together with his regular sidekicks Chicago (Geoffrey Binney) and Rhino (George Memmoli). Jim Kelly who is an International Middleweight Karate Champion choreographed the film’s fight scenes.

results.title: Red dust
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, Hunt Stromberg, Victor Fleming Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on a play by Wilson Collison, “Red Dust” is a fiery romance drama set on a rubber plantation in Vietnam. Dennis Carson (Clark Gable) is happy in the ‘male’ world of the rubber plantation which he runs. Then one day Vantine (Jean Harlow), a brassy blonde floozy escaping from some ‘trouble’ in Saigon arrives at the plantation. The sparks fly as Vantine wears down Carson’s gruff exterior with her special charms. Then Gary Willis (Gene Raymond) a surveyor arrives with his earnest, refined wife Barbara (Mary Astor). Tensions rise as Carson dumps Vantine and begins pursuing Barbara. Directed by Victor Fleming, “Red Dust” perfectly teams the masculine and feminine sexual personas of Harlow and Gable. In 1953 the film was remade, again with Gable, as “Mogambo”.

results.title: Risky business
results.creator_credit: Paul Brickman, Steve Tisch, Jon Avnet and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Joel Goodsen is an industrious, responsible and college bound teen whose parents are going on vacation and leaving him in charge of the house. No sooner do Joel’s parents leave when Joel begins to step outside of his conservative and respectable self. Transforming from a straight A high school star athlete to an uninhibited party animal, Joel invites his friends to enjoy his hospitality, as well as his parents’ liquor. Things go from bad to worse when he meets a streetwise callgirl, Lana, who lives the theories of free enterprise and high finance Joel’s been studying. Cast includes Tom Cruise, Rebecca deMornay, Curtis Armstrong, Bronson Pinchot and Raphael Sbarge.
